meanings.definition: Strong and offensive in odor or flavor
meanings.sent1: The rankness of the garbage left a foul smell in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The cheese had a strong rankness that made it unpleasant to eat.
meanings.sent3: The rankness of the old socks was so bad, even the dog avoided them.
meanings.sent4: The rankness of the fish market hit us like a wave of stench.
meanings.sent5: The rankness of the spoiled milk was enough to make anyone gag.

meanings.sent1: The rankness of the ivy covered the entire wall in just a few weeks.
meanings.sent2: The plants in the jungle displayed a lush rankness that was awe-inspiring.
meanings.sent3: The rankness of the garden was so wild, it seemed like a jungle in miniature.
meanings.sent4: The rankness of the vines climbing the tree symbolized nature's unstoppable growth.
meanings.sent5: The rankness of the grass in the field made it a perfect hiding spot.

meanings.sent1: The rankness of the storm brought heavy rains and strong winds.
meanings.sent2: His rankness in collecting stamps led to a room overflowing with albums.
meanings.sent3: The rankness of her excitement for the concert was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The rankness of the traffic jam made it impossible to move for hours.
meanings.sent5: The rankness of the dessert buffet tempted even the most disciplined dieter.
